channel.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
channel.description:
I'm no beginner with coding or anything like that. But I have never really messed with this, and when I have I can never get it to work. And yes I have looked around these forums, others, the internet, etc...but it's all about delta no help towards this. If you guys could help me find out how to do this it would be great, I will definitely rep!
Picture of what I need to be opened
[img]http://img822.imageshack.us/img822/8863/doorclosed.png[/img]
And here's my doors code [code]//the door starts as closed // South 0 face = doorX -1 face = -3 // East -1 face = doorY -1 face = 0 // North -2 face = doorX +1 face = -1 // West -3 face = doorY +1 face = -2
// doorX doorY Height Face State //0 closed, 1 open door = 2603 3082 0 0 0 //THIS IS THE ONE IM NEEDING TO OPEN door = 2606 3152 0 -1 1 door = 1551 3080 3501 0 0
door = 2855 3546 0 0 0 //duel arena gate door = 2854 3546 0 0 0 //duel arena gate door = 3253 3266 0 0 0 //cow gate
door = 2611 3398 0 0 1 //cow gate
door = 3268 3227 0 0 0 //al kharid gates door = 3268 3228 0 0 0
door = 3562 9694 0 -2 0 //barrows door door = 3563 9694 0 -1 1
//door = 2949 3379 0 0 0 //fally hair shop //door = 2948 3379 0 -3 1
door = 3234 3426 0 -2 0 door = 3235 3426 0 -1 1
door = 3238 3210 0 0 0 door = 3237 3210 0 -3 1
door = 3234 3207 0 0 0 door = 3233 3207 0 -3 1
door = 3079 3497 0 -2 0 door = 3079 3497 0 -1 1
//the door starts as opened // South 0 face = doorY +1 face = -1 // East -1 face = doorX -1 face = -2 // North -2 face = doorY -1 face = -3 // West -3 face = doorX +1 face = 0
// doorX doorY Height Face State //0 closed, 1 open
door = 3231 3433 0 -2 1 door = 3231 3432 0 -3 0
door = 2950 3385 0 -2 1 door = 2950 3384 0 -3 0
door = 3249 3435 0 -1 1 door = 3248 3435 0 -2 0
door = 3253 3431 0 -2 1 door = 3253 3430 0 -3 0
door = 3233 3427 0 0 1 door = 3233 3428 0 -1 0
door = 3217 3219 0 0 0 door = 3216 3219 0 -3 1
door = 3101 3510 0 0 0 door = 3101 3509 0 0 0
door = 2816 3438 0 -3 0 //door = 3101 3509 0 1 0 //door = 3101 3510 0 -1 0
[ENDOFDOORLIST]
[/code]

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Acorn_:

There’s a way to make the same object teleport you out with the same method I just can’t quite remember at the moment.

If you can you have no idea how much it would help me!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:

There’s a way to make the same object teleport you out with the same method I just can’t quite remember at the moment.

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

@Acron_ Yeah That’s what I’ve been doing since I can’t make it so they actually open and whatever. But if I do that that thing that just teleports you in and out. Then I can’t use the same door to teleport out. I’d have to use another object.

Read full topic

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @hunterowner3 hunterowner3
item.description:
@hunterowner3 wrote:

Acorn be stealing my rep! Haha, jk jk.

Read full topic

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Just make the door teleport you in and out, that’s what I do…
Actionhandler.java

case 1533: c.getPA().movePlayer(2603, 3082, 0); break;

Read full topic

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @hunterowner3 hunterowner3
item.description:
@hunterowner3 wrote:

You need to put the case for the door also. Check actionhandler.java.
For example, case [DOOR ID]: c.getPA().movePlayer(xxxx, yyyy, 0); break;

Read full topic

item.title: Help[PI] Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

RandQm:

I learned it from tuts maybe u just have to search and not be lazy

I clearly said I searched but they were all DELTA tutorials…

I’m no beginner with coding or anything like that. But I have never really messed with this, and when I have I can never get it to work. And yes I have looked around these forums, others, the internet, etc…but it’s all about delta no help towards this. Picture of what I need to be opened

// South 0 face = doorX -1 face = -3
